title: What is the area of a regular pentagon of side 8cm? - Quora

response.answer_text: Consider the area of a triangle whose edges are a side of the pentagon and two lines from the ends of that side to the centre of the pentagon.The base angle of this triangle is 54 degrees; so its area is one-half(base x altitude) = 1/2[8x(4.tan54)] = 22.0221107…sq cms.The whole pentagon is five of those triangles, so its area is 110.1105536…sq cms Here it is measured in Sketchup.
